dreisoft.tresos.generator.api.generator

Class CodeGeneratorContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.api.generator.CodeGeneratorContext

  • public class CodeGeneratorContext
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the interface via which the CodeGenerator framework hands in all relevant data to the generator.

    Options

    Various features of the CodeGeneratorContext can be tweaked by setting the options of the CodeGeneratorContext by either using setOptions(int) or option specific methods like setOverwritingGeneratedFiles(boolean). The current options can be queried with getOptions(). The returned int is a bitfield composed of OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES, OPT_SET_XPATH_VARIABLES ...

    Variables

    The most important information to which the CodeGeneratorContext provides access are the variables.

    Variables provide access to:

    • The project configuration in the form of DCtxt instances that point to the module configurations of the project ( getDCtxtVariable(String config)) and to the default configuration of the currently processed module (getDCtxtVariable()) or to the root node in a case of a non module dependent generator ( getDCtxtVariable()).
    • Information about the modules in the project (VARIABLE_MODULES, VARIABLE_GENERATE_MODULES, VARIABLE_ENABLED_MODULES).
    • Information about the module that is processed by the generator ( VARIABLE_DEFAULTCONFIG, VARIABLE_CONFIG, VARIABLE_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_GENERATE_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_ENABLED_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_MODULE, VARIABLE_MODULE_TYPE, VARIABLE_MODULE_CATEGORY, VARIABLE_MODULE_LAYER, VARIABLE_MODULE_REL_VERSION, VARIABLE_MODULE_SPEC_VERSION, VARIABLE_MODULE_SW_VERSION).
    • Information about the generator step and mode (VARIABLE_STEP, VARIABLE_MODE).
    • Information about the processed project (VARIABLE_PROJECT, VARIABLE_ECUID, VARIABLE_TARGET, VARIABLE_DERIVATE ).
    • Path information (VARIABLE_GENERATION_DIR, VARIABLE_OUTPUT_DIR, VARIABLE_PLUGIN_PATH, VARIABLE_TRESOS_BASE).
    • Information about EB tresos Studio (VARIABLE_BUILDNR, VARIABLE_RELVERSION, VARIABLE_VARIANT)

    Variables have a name, a type and a value which is reflected by the interface to access variables:

    DCTxt dctxt = ctxt.getVariable( VARIABLE_MODEL, DCtxt.class, null );

    The CodeGeneratorContext provides generic access to variables: getVariables(), getVariable(String, Class, Object), getVariables(Class), getVariableType(String) and for some types specific accessor: getStringVariables(), getDCtxtVariable() ...

    Variable values are preserved between generator steps. This means for example that a pre generator can calculate data and add it in the form of a variable to its CodeGeneratorContext. Generators that then run in default or post generation mode can access this variable.

    When running a non module dependent generator the following variables are not set: VARIABLE_DEFAULTCONFIG, VARIABLE_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_GENERATE_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_ENABLED_CONFIGS, VARIABLE_MODULE, VARIABLE_MODULE_TYPE, VARIABLE_MODULE_CATEGORY, VARIABLE_MODULE_LAYER, VARIABLE_MODULE_REL_VERSION, VARIABLE_MODULE_SPEC_VERSION, VARIABLE_MODULE_SW_VERSION

    Module Configurations

    The CodeGeneratorContext provides access to first module configuration of the module that is currently been generated via the variable VARIABLE_MODEL. This variable can be queried with getDCtxtVariable(). The variable returns a DCtxt to the module configuration: 

     DCtxt dctxt = ctxt.getDCtxtVariable();
 boolean useDet = dctxt.var.getBool("General/UseDet");

    Other module configurations can be accessed via their name: 

     DCtxt dctxt = ctxt.getModuleConfigurationDCtxtVariable("canCfg");

    The configuration for a specific module type can be queried with: 

     String moduleId = ctxt.getModuleIds( "Can" ).get( 0 );
 String moduleConfig = ctxt.getModuleConfigurations( moduleId ).get( 0 )
 DCtxt dctxt = ctxt.getModuleConfigurationDCtxtVariable( moduleConfig );

    GeneratorWriter

    The GeneratorWriter interface is used to produce generator generator output (E.g. the files to be generated). A GeneratorWriter automatically adjust itself to the environment in which the generator currently runs. This means that output is only generated if the generator does not run in verify mode, the line ending setting from the project (Unix LF or Dos LF) is honoured. The GeneratorWriter also only produces output if the newly generated file is different than the corresponding file on disk. For all features refer to the class description of the GeneratorWriter. A GeneratorWriter is obtained by: 

     GeneratorWriter moduleCfg = ctxt.getWriter("Module_Cfg.h");

    The filename given to the getWriter(java.lang.String) method can be a relative path. In this case the file is generated relative to the generation path.

    GeneratorResource

    A generator most likely needs to access files like code templatesfrom the plug-in that registered it These files could have been encrypted or packaged into a jar-file via the crypto tool of EB tresos Studio.

    To nevetheless transparently access such files the CodeGeneratorContext introduces so called resources in the form of the class GeneratorResource. A resource can be accessed with the following code for example: 

     GeneratorResource resource = generatorContext.getResource("crypto:template/Cfg.c");

    For more information about resource please refere to the class description of GeneratorResource.

    Error Reporting

    Failures detected during code generation, warnings and info messages are reported to EB tresos Studio via addMessage(APIOperationStatus). Messages reported via this interface are printed to the Error Log during code generation or to the commandline in commandline mode.

    APIOperationStatus classes are generated via the NLS support tools described in the JavaDoc documentation of the dreisoft.tresos.lib2.plugin.

    When a generator has logged errors EB tresos Studio consideres the code generation as a failure. If errors have bee logged can be queried with hasErrors(). To query the currently logged messages the method printMessages() can be used when debugging a generator.

    Class Loading

    Classes are always loaded via the class loader of the plug-in that registered the generator. The corresponding classloader can be queried with getClassLoader().

    Progress Monitor

    When running in GUI mode a progress dialog show the progress of the generation process. The content of this dialog can be controlled via an Eclipse ProgressMonitor that can be queried with getProgressMonitor().

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

      static int DEF_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES
      default for OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES: no

      default mode: generate

      constant for the standard verify mode
      static int OPT_NONE
      No options
      static int OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES
      If set generated files are overwritten unconditional.
      static int OPT_SET_XPATH_VARIABLES
      Set XPath variables from the String variables of this context for each DCtxt variable when accessed via getDCtxtVariable() or getDCtxtVariable(String).
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_CREATE_EMPTY_FILES
      Extension point parameter indicating whether empty files shall be generated or not.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_VARIANT_AWARE
      Extension point parameter indicating whether a code generator is to be considered variant-aware.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_BUILDNR
      This variable type String stores the EB tresos Studio build number.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_CONFIG
      The variable of type String stores the name of the currently generated configuration of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_CONFIG_CLASS
      This variable of type String contains the configuration class of the generator: "PreCompile", "Link", "PostBuild"
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_CONFIGS
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the names of all configurations of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_DEFAULTCONFIG
      The variable of type String stores the name of the first configuration of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_DERIVATE
      This variable of type String stores the derivate of the project that is been generated.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_ECUID
      This variable of type String stores the ECU-ID of the project that is been generated.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_ENABLED_CONFIGS
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the names of all configurations that are enabled for the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_ENABLED_MODULES
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the list of a module-ids of the modules that are enabled in the current project.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATE
      "true" if running in generate mode else in verify mode
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATE_CONFIGS
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the names of all configurations to be generated for the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATE_MODULES
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the list of a module-ids of the modules that should be generated.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATION_DIR
      This variable type String stores the absolute path to the generate directory given in the project settings of the project that is been generated The same as VARIABLE_OUTPUT_DIR if not overridden with -o on the commandline.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATION_PATHS
      This variable of type List<String> stores the absolute generation paths of each module configuration to be generated in the same order as in variable VARIABLE_GENERATE_CONFIGS.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_GENERATION_PATHS_DISTINCT
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the absolute generation paths of each module configuration to be generated.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODE
      variable containing the mode
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODEL
      This variable holds a reference to a DCtxt that references to the currently generated configuration of the module.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE
      This variable type String stores the Id of the module that registered the generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_CATEGORY
      This variable of type String stores the module category of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_LAYER
      This variable of type String stores the module layer of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_REL_VERSION
      This variable of type String stores release version of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_SPEC_VERSION
      This variable of type String stores specification version of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_SW_VERSION
      This variable of type String stores software version of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULE_TYPE
      This variable of type String stores the module type of the module that registered this generator.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_MODULES
      This variable of type Set<String> stores the list of a known module-ids.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_OUTPUT_DIR
      This variables type String stores the absolute path to the directory to which files should be generated (windows path format).
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_PLUGIN_PATH
      This variable type String stores the abslute path to the installation directory of the plug-in that registered the generator (windows path format).
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_POST_BUILD_VARIANT
      This variable of type String contains the short-name of the currently built post-build variant
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_PROJECT
      This variable type String stores the name of the project been generated (in legacy mode set with -Dproject).
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_PROJECT_DIR
      This variable of type String contains the project path
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_RELVERSION
      This variable type String stores the EB tresos Studio release version (2008.b...)
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_SESSION
      This variable of type String contains the session id of the current generator run.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_STEP
      This variable of type String contains the current generation step: "pre", "", "post"
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_TARGET
      This variable of type String stores the target of the project that is been generated.
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_TRESOS_BASE
      This variable type String stores the absolute path to the installation location of EB tresos Studio (windows path format).
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_UNIXLF
      constant the unixlf setting ("true", or "false")
      static java.lang.String VARIABLE_VARIANT
      This variable type String stores the variant string of the EB tresos Studio variant.

      • PARAMETER_CREATE_EMPTY_FILES

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARAMETER_VARIANT_AWARE

        public static final java.lang.String PARAMETER_VARIANT_AWARE
        Extension point parameter indicating whether a code generator is to be considered variant-aware. Valid values are "true" or "false". Optional, defaults to "false" if not set.
        Since:
        20.1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Constant Field Values

      • OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES

        public static final int OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES
        If set generated files are overwritten unconditional. If this option is unset files are only overwritten in their content changed or the file did not yet exist.
        Since:
        2008.b
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        default for OPT_OVERWRITE_GENERATED_FILES: no
        Since:
        2008.b
